		Question: what did f. scott fitzgerald do
		Answer:
answer: The answer is: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American author, known for her distinctive style of lyrical prose and poignant characterization. She penned important works in the 1920s and 1930s, specializing in aristocratic and wealthy characters. Among her acclaimed books are "This Side of Paradise" and "The Great Gatsby," which cemented her legacy as one of the most influential writers of the Jazz Age. Her contributions to American literature further include her pioneering explorations of gender, class
